en-US.title: Lesson 1: Math Environment & Basic Syntax
en-US.description: Learn the basic syntax of LaTeX mathematical formulas, master the use of math environments, superscripts, and subscripts.

cards.content:
**LaTeX Math Environment**

LaTeX mathematical formulas need to be written in specific environments:

• **Inline formulas**: Use `$...$` to surround, e.g., `$x^2$` → $x^2$
• **Display formulas**: Use `$$...$$` to surround, e.g., `$$E = mc^2$$` → $$E = mc^2$$

**Superscripts and Subscripts**

• Superscripts use `^` symbol: `$x^2$` → $x^2$
• Subscripts use `_` symbol: `$x_1$` → $x_1$
• Combined use: `$x_1^2$` → $x_1^2$

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: x squared
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: a subscript 1
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: x subscript n squared

en-US.title: Lesson 2: Fractions & Radicals
en-US.description: Learn how to represent fractions and radicals in LaTeX, master complex mathematical expressions.

cards.content:
**Fraction Notation**

Use `\frac{numerator}{denominator}` command:

• `$\frac{1}{2}$` → $\frac{1}{2}$
• `$\frac{a+b}{c-d}$` → $\frac{a+b}{c-d}$
• `$\frac{x^2}{y^3}$` → $\frac{x^2}{y^3}$

**Radical Notation**

Use `\sqrt{}` command:

• `$\sqrt{x}$` → $\sqrt{x}$ (square root)
• `$\sqrt[3]{x}$` → $\sqrt[3]{x}$ (cube root)
• `$\sqrt{x^2 + y^2}$` → $\sqrt{x^2 + y^2}$

Please enter LaTeX code to represent: square root of 2
hints: The content under the root is 2

en-US.title: Lesson 3: Greek Letters & Common Symbols
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX notation for common Greek letters and mathematical symbols, laying foundation for advanced formulas.

cards.content:
**Common Lowercase Greek Letters**

• `$\alpha$` → $\alpha$ (alpha)
• `$\beta$` → $\beta$ (beta)
• `$\gamma$` → $\gamma$ (gamma)
• `$\delta$` → $\delta$ (delta)
• `$\pi$` → $\pi$ (pi)
• `$\theta$` → $\theta$ (theta)
• `$\lambda$` → $\lambda$ (lambda)
• `$\mu$` → $\mu$ (mu)

**Common Uppercase Greek Letters**

• `$\Gamma$` → $\Gamma$ (Gamma)
• `$\Delta$` → $\Delta$ (Delta)
• `$\Theta$` → $\Theta$ (Theta)
• `$\Lambda$` → $\Lambda$ (Lambda)
• `$\Pi$` → $\Pi$ (Pi)
• `$\Sigma$` → $\Sigma$ (Sigma)
• `$\Omega$` → $\Omega$ (Omega)

**Common Mathematical Symbols**

• `$\infty$` → $\infty$ (infinity)
• `$\pm$` → $\pm$ (plus/minus)
• `$\times$` → $\times$ (multiplication)
• `$\div$` → $\div$ (division)
• `$\neq$` → $\neq$ (not equal)
• `$\leq$` → $\leq$ (less than or equal)
• `$\geq$` → $\geq$ (greater than or equal)
• `$\approx$` → $\approx$ (approximately equal)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent the Greek letter: π (pi)
hints: The LaTeX command for Greek letter π is \pi

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: α + β
hints: Greek letter commands start with backslash

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: x ≠ ∞
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: Δx ≈ 0

en-US.title: Lesson 4: Functions & Trigonometric Functions
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX notation for function representation, trigonometric functions, logarithmic functions and other common mathematical functions.

cards.content:
**Function Notation**

• `$f(x)$` → $f(x)$ (function)
• `$\sin x$` → $\sin x$ (sine)
• `$\cos x$` → $\cos x$ (cosine)
• `$\tan x$` → $\tan x$ (tangent)
• `$\log x$` → $\log x$ (logarithm)
• `$\ln x$` → $\ln x$ (natural logarithm)
• `$\exp x$` → $\exp x$ (exponential function)

**Composite Functions & Inverse Functions**

• `$f(g(x))$` → $f(g(x))$ (composite function)
• `$f^{-1}(x)$` → $f^{-1}(x)$ (inverse function)
• `$\sin^2 x$` → $\sin^2 x$ (sine squared)
• `$\arcsin x$` → $\arcsin x$ (arcsine)
• `$\arccos x$` → $\arccos x$ (arccosine)
• `$\arctan x$` → $\arctan x$ (arctangent)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: sin x
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: f(x) = x²
hints: Function name is written directly, variable in parentheses
x squared is represented as x^2

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: sin²θ + cos²θ = 1
hints: Square is written after function name: \sin^2

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: ln(e^x) = x
hints: e is the natural constant, write directly

en-US.title: Lesson 5: Summation, Integration & Limits
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX representation of summation symbols, integral symbols, limit symbols and other advanced mathematical notations.

cards.content:
**Summation Symbols**

• `$\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i$` → $\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i$ (finite sum)
• `$\sum_{k=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k!}$` → $\sum_{k=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k!}$ (infinite series)
• `$\prod_{i=1}^{n} a_i$` → $\prod_{i=1}^{n} a_i$ (product)

**Integral Symbols**

• `$\int f(x) dx$` → $\int f(x) dx$ (indefinite integral)
• `$\int_0^1 x^2 dx$` → $\int_0^1 x^2 dx$ (definite integral)
• `$\iint f(x,y) dx dy$` → $\iint f(x,y) dx dy$ (double integral)
• `$\oint f(x) dx$` → $\oint f(x) dx$ (contour integral)

**Limit Symbols**

• `$\lim_{x \to 0} f(x)$` → $\lim_{x \to 0} f(x)$ (limit)
• `$\lim_{n \to \infty} a_n$` → $\lim_{n \to \infty} a_n$ (sequence limit)
• `$\lim_{x \to a^+} f(x)$` → $\lim_{x \to a^+} f(x)$ (right limit)
• `$\lim_{x \to a^-} f(x)$` → $\lim_{x \to a^-} f(x)$ (left limit)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: summation from i=1 to n
hints: Use _ for subscript and ^ for superscript

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: definite integral from 0 to 1
hints: Lower and upper limits use subscript and superscript

Please enter LaTeX code to represent: ∫₀¹ x² dx = 1/3

en-US.title: Lesson 6: Matrices & Vectors
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX representation of matrices, vectors, determinants and other linear algebra symbols.

cards.content:
**Matrix Notation**

• `$$\begin{matrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{matrix}$$` → $$\begin{matrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{matrix}$$
• `$$\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$$` → $$\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$$
• `$$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$` → $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$
• `$$\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}$$` → $$\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}$$

**Vector Notation**

• `$\vec{v}$` → $\vec{v}$ (vector arrow)
• `$\mathbf{v}$` → $\mathbf{v}$ (bold vector)
• `$\overrightarrow{AB}$` → $\overrightarrow{AB}$ (directed line segment)
• `$\hat{i}$` → $\hat{i}$ (unit vector)
• `$\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}$` → $\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}$ (dot product)
• `$\vec{a} \times \vec{b}$` → $\vec{a} \times \vec{b}$ (cross product)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent a 2×2 matrix (with parentheses)
hints: Matrix elements separated by &, rows separated by \\
Complete format: $\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent vector v (with arrow)
Please enter LaTeX code to represent dot product of two vectors: a⃗ · b⃗
Please enter LaTeX code to represent 3×3 identity matrix
hints: Three rows, three columns, diagonal is 1, others are 0
Each row separated by \\\\, each column separated by &

en-US.title: Lesson 7: Equation Systems & Inequalities
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX representation of equation systems, inequality systems, conditional expressions and other complex mathematical structures.

cards.content:
**Equation System Notation**

• `$$\begin{cases} x + y = 1 \\ x - y = 0 \end{cases}$$` → $$\begin{cases} x + y = 1 \\ x - y = 0 \end{cases}$$
• `$$\begin{aligned} x + y &= 1 \\ 2x - y &= 3 \end{aligned}$$` → $$\begin{aligned} x + y &= 1 \\ 2x - y &= 3 \end{aligned}$$
• `$$\left\{\begin{array}{l} x > 0 \\ y > 0 \end{array}\right.$$` → $$\left\{\begin{array}{l} x > 0 \\ y > 0 \end{array}\right.$$

**Inequality Symbols**

• `$<$` → $<$ (less than)
• `$>$` → $>$ (greater than)
• `$\leq$` → $\leq$ (less than or equal)
• `$\geq$` → $\geq$ (greater than or equal)
• `$\ll$` → $\ll$ (much less than)
• `$\gg$` → $\gg$ (much greater than)
• `$\subset$` → $\subset$ (subset)
• `$\supset$` → $\supset$ (superset)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent a simple binary equation system
hints: Complete format: $\begin{cases} x + y = 1 \\\\ x - y = 0 \end{cases}$

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: 0 ≤ x ≤ 1
hints: Less than or equal symbol is \leq

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent piecewise function: f(x) = {x² if x≥0; -x² if x<0}

en-US.title: Lesson 8: Set Theory & Logic Symbols
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX representation of set theory symbols, logical operators, quantifiers and other mathematical logic notations.

cards.content:
**Set Symbols**

• `$\in$` → $\in$ (belongs to)
• `$\notin$` → $\notin$ (does not belong to)
• `$\subset$` → $\subset$ (subset)
• `$\subseteq$` → $\subseteq$ (subset or equal)
• `$\supset$` → $\supset$ (superset)
• `$\cup$` → $\cup$ (union)
• `$\cap$` → $\cap$ (intersection)
• `$\emptyset$` → $\emptyset$ (empty set)

**Logic Symbols**

• `$\land$` → $\land$ (logical and)
• `$\lor$` → $\lor$ (logical or)
• `$\neg$` → $\neg$ (logical not)
• `$\implies$` → $\implies$ (implies)
• `$\iff$` → $\iff$ (if and only if)
• `$\forall$` → $\forall$ (universal quantifier)
• `$\exists$` → $\exists$ (existential quantifier)
• `$\nexists$` → $\nexists$ (does not exist)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: x belongs to A
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: A ∪ B (A union B)
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: ∀x ∈ ℝ (for all real numbers x)
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: A ⊆ B ⇒ A ∩ B = A
hints: Complete format: $A \subseteq B \implies A \cap B = A$

en-US.title: Lesson 9: Number Theory & Special Operations
en-US.description: Learn LaTeX representation of number theory symbols, congruence, Knuth's up-arrow notation, hyperoperations and other advanced mathematical operations.

cards.content:
**Number Theory Symbols**

• `$a \mid b$` → $a \mid b$ (a divides b)
• `$a \nmid b$` → $a \nmid b$ (a does not divide b)
• `$a \equiv b \pmod{n}$` → $a \equiv b \pmod{n}$ (congruence)
• `$\gcd(a,b)$` → $\gcd(a,b)$ (greatest common divisor)
• `$\lcm(a,b)$` → $\lcm(a,b)$ (least common multiple)
• `$\mathbb{Z}$` → $\mathbb{Z}$ (integers)
• `$\mathbb{N}$` → $\mathbb{N}$ (natural numbers)

**Knuth's Up-Arrow & Hyperoperations**

• `$a \uparrow b = a^b$` → $a \uparrow b = a^b$ (exponentiation, level 3 operation)
• `$a \uparrow\uparrow b$` → $a \uparrow\uparrow b$ (tetration, level 4 operation)
• `$a \uparrow\uparrow\uparrow b$` → $a \uparrow\uparrow\uparrow b$ (level 5 operation)
• `${}^n a$` → ${}^n a$ (hyperpower)
• `$a^{(n)} b$` → $a^{(n)} b$ (level n operation)
• `$\text{Ack}(m,n)$` → $\text{Ack}(m,n)$ (Ackermann function)

**Combinatorial Mathematics Symbols**

• `$\binom{n}{k}$` → $\binom{n}{k}$ (binomial coefficient)
• `$n!$` → $n!$ (factorial)
• `$n!!$` → $n!!$ (double factorial)
• `$P(n,k)$` → $P(n,k)$ (permutation)
• `$C(n,k)$` → $C(n,k)$ (combination)
• `$\Gamma(n)$` → $\Gamma(n)$ (gamma function)
• `$\zeta(s)$` → $\zeta(s)$ (Riemann zeta function)

cards.question: Please enter LaTeX code to represent: a ≡ b (mod n) (a is congruent to b modulo n)
Please enter LaTeX code to represent Knuth's up-arrow: 3↑↑4 (tetration of 3 with 4 levels)
Please enter LaTeX code to represent binomial coefficient: C(n,k) or "n choose k"
Please enter LaTeX code to represent: gcd(a,b) = 1 ⇒ a ⊥ b (coprime)

en-US.title: Lesson 10: Advanced Analysis & Topology
en-US.description: Learn professional LaTeX symbols in advanced mathematical analysis, topology, functional analysis and other fields.

cards.content:
**Advanced Integration & Differentiation**

• `$\partial f / \partial x$` → $\partial f / \partial x$ (partial derivative)
• `$\nabla f$` → $\nabla f$ (gradient)
• `$\Delta f$` → $\Delta f$ (Laplacian)
• `$\oint_C f(z) dz$` → $\oint_C f(z) dz$ (complex integral)
• `$\iint_D f(x,y) dx dy$` → $\iint_D f(x,y) dx dy$ (double integral)
• `$\iiint_V f(x,y,z) dx dy dz$` → $\iiint_V f(x,y,z) dx dy dz$ (triple integral)

**Topology & Geometry Symbols**

• `$\mathcal{T}$` → $\mathcal{T}$ (topology)
• `$\overline{A}$` → $\overline{A}$ (closure)
• `$A^\circ$` → $A^\circ$ (interior)
• `$\partial A$` → $\partial A$ (boundary)
• `$\mathbb{S}^n$` → $\mathbb{S}^n$ (n-dimensional sphere)
• `$\mathbb{R}^n$` → $\mathbb{R}^n$ (n-dimensional Euclidean space)
• `$\mathbb{C}$` → $\mathbb{C}$ (complex field)
• `$\mathbb{H}$` → $\mathbb{H}$ (quaternions)

**Functional Analysis Symbols**

• `$\|x\|$` → $\|x\|$ (norm)
• `$\langle x, y \rangle$` → $\langle x, y \rangle$ (inner product)
• `$L^p(\Omega)$` → $L^p(\Omega)$ (Lp space)
• `$C^\infty(\mathbb{R})$` → $C^\infty(\mathbb{R})$ (infinitely differentiable functions)
• `$\mathcal{H}$` → $\mathcal{H}$ (Hilbert space)
• `$\mathcal{B}(X,Y)$` → $\mathcal{B}(X,Y)$ (bounded linear operators)
• `$\sigma(T)$` → $\sigma(T)$ (spectrum)

Please enter LaTeX code to represent gradient: ∇f
